alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 11:01PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Adams, northern Kearney, Buffalo, southeastern Sherman, southwestern Howard and western Hall Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Pleasanton to near Kearney to Axtell. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pleasanton around 1110 PM CDT. Gibbon around 1115 PM CDT. Hazard around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Shelton, Poole, Ravenna, Rockville and Heartwell. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 269 and 295. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Hall; Howard; Kearney; Sherman
